benchmark_details.name: An open access NLP dataset for Arabic dialects
benchmark_details.overview: This paper presents an open data set of social data content in several Arabic dialects, collected from Twitter and consisting of +50K tweets in five national dialects, labeled for several applications such as dialect detection, topic detection, and sentiment analysis.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To enhance innovation and practical applications of NLP for dialectal Arabic by providing an open access dataset.

data.source: Tweets collected from Twitter in five Arab countries (Algeria, Egypt, Lebanon, Tunisia, Morocco).
data.annotation: Manual labeling with a semi-automatic process for dialect detection, topic detection, and sentiment analysis.

methodology.calculation: F1 Score is calculated using precision and recall. Accuracy is calculated as the number of correct predictions divided by the total number of predictions.
methodology.interpretation: Performance evaluation is used to assess the effectiveness of the models in identifying dialects, topics, and sentiments.
methodology.validation: The dataset was validated through performance evaluation of machine learning models on the labeled data.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: User accounts were anonymized by removing user mentions.
